pullrequest.title: Added exits on errors to prevent false-success docker builds

content.raw:
Thanks for the contribution!

I think the `gzweb_2.0.0` branch is still in experimental mode at the moment, the latest recommended release branch is `gzweb_1.3.0` and there is active development going on `default`. Feel free to make pull requests to those branches too if you wish and I can merge them.

Cheers
content.html:
Thanks for the contribution!

I think the gzweb_2.0.0 branch is still in experimental mode at the moment, the latest recommended release branch is gzweb_1.3.0 and there is active development going on default. Feel free to make pull requests to those branches too if you wish and I can merge them.

Cheers

pullrequest.title: Added exits on errors to prevent false-success docker builds

content.raw:
Also, using then following would speed up deploy.sh. Same for the Dockerfile for osrf/gazebo

    hg clone /path/to/your/repo -r 0
    hg pull -u -b branchname

I might not be making sense since I've used hg only sporadically
content.html:

pullrequest.title: Added exits on errors to prevent false-success docker builds

content.raw:
I think you could achieve the same result with:

`hg clone http://url/of/repo -b branchname`

That should definitely speed things up, `gazebo_models` has many branches, and they are not needed here.
content.html:
I think you could achieve the same result with:

hg clone http://url/of/repo -b branchname

That should definitely speed things up, gazebo_models has many branches, and they are not needed here.
